title: Turkey's opposition picks candidate to take on Erdogan in May election
description: A six-party alliance on Monday nominated main opposition party leader Kemal Kilicdaroglu as its common candidate to challenge President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, ending months of uncertainty and bickering.

title: North Korea accuses the US of 'intentionally' aggravating relations
description: The statement from North Korea's foreign ministry also said that the continuation of joint military drills could lead to 'violent physical conflict in the Korean peninsula.'

title: In India, political opponents are government targets
description: Since Narendra Modi became prime minister in 2014, at least 124 prominent politicians have been investigated by the Central Bureau of Investigation.

title: Retired French expats seek the 'France of the past' in Portugal: 'Here, they have respect for authority'
description: Thousands of French citizens are retiring in the southern Portuguese region of Algarve, both due to the appealing tax system but also the desire to escape from what some describe as an 'unlivable,' violent' and 'deteriorating' situation in their homeland.

title: Russia declares Transparency International 'undesirable'
description: The non-governmental organization, known for its annual index ranking countries on their degree of corruption, is banned from the country.

title: Brazil's biggest serial killer dies in shootout
description: Pedro Rodrigues Filho, referred to as "Brazil's biggest serial killer," died on Sunday of multiple gunshot wounds.

title: PSG's Neymar to undergo ankle surgery, miss rest of season
description: The Brazilian football player injured his ankle on February 19, during a PSG-Lille match of the French Ligue 1.

title: Four US citizens kidnapped in Mexico, manhunt ongoing
description: The FBI is offering a $50,000 reward for help finding the unidentified victims and arresting the perpetrators of the incident in which a Mexican national was killed.

title: Few French support Macron's proposed pension reform
description: Only one-third of the population backs the government's bill, according to various opinion polls.

title: In Ethiopia's Tigray region, the wounds of war remain raw
description: Four months after the peace agreement was signed in Pretoria, Tigrayans bear witness to the large-scale violence they suffered at the hands of Ethiopian, Eritrean and Amhara forces.

title: Kyiv launches international center to probe war
description: With the establishment of a new International Center for the Prosecution of the Crime of Aggression, Ukraine is moving toward the creation of a special court to try Russian violence.

title: Ghosts of Stalinist terror haunt Kyiv's outskirts
description: The site of Bykivnia, in the suburbs of the Ukrainian capital, remains little known although at least 20,000 victims of Stalinist repression are buried there.

title: Unions prepare for rolling strikes in protest of French pension reform
description: France's unions have announced historic demonstrations for Tuesday as they plan the continuation of the protest movement.

title: Unstoppable progress of Iran's nuclear program troubles the West
description: International Atomic Energy Agency Director General Rafael Grossi secured fresh commitments from Iran to restart monitoring of its activities following a visit to Tehran.

title: John Paul II covered up child abuse while cardinal, Polish television says
description: According to Polish broadcaster TVN, the former pope knew of cases of pedophile priests within the church while a cardinal in Krakow.

title: In Greece, artists are revolting
description: For the past two months, performing arts students and professionals have been up in arms against a government decree they believe devalues their diplomas and careers.

title: Bashar Al-Assad, expert in disaster diplomacy
description: Following the earthquake that hit Syria, the country's president is taking advantage of the solidarity of Arab leaders to put the normalization of the Syrian regime back on the agenda.

title: France launches 'anti-inflation quarter' for food prices
description: Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said retail groups would cut prices for a wide range of products "to the lowest possible level" until June.

title: Ukraine determined to hold on to Bakhmut as Russian troops close in
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky chaired a meeting during which the country's top brass advocated strengthening Ukrainian positions in the Donetsk city.

title: Belarus sentences exiled opposition leader to 15 years
description: Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya left Belarus following the 2020 unprecedented mass protests that erupted after President Lukashenko secured a sixth term in office.

title: Pakistan: At least ten police officers killed in suicide attack
description: The officers were on a routine patrol in southwestern Pakistan when a suicide bomber on a motorcycle rammed into their truck.

title: Tennis: Djokovic withdraws from Indian Wells in US visa row
description: Unvaccinated foreigners are currently barred from entry into the US, a policy that is expected to be lifted when the government ends its Covid-19 emergency declarations on May 11.

title: Michelin 2023 awards: List of winners gives pride of place to French regions
description: One new three-star, four new two-stars, 39 newcomers to the ranking and 90 green stars distinguish an edition that also highlights some very young talents.

title: In Sistan and Baluchestan, the last glowing embers of Iran's protest movement
description: The marginalized southeastern province continues to protest every Friday despite attempted crackdowns by the authorities.

title: In Iran, suspicious poisonings are escalating and spreading
description: Poisonings were reported in several hundred girls' schools. It is seen as 'revenge' by the regime in response to the youth uprising following the death of Mahsa Amini.

title: Macron's new Africa 'partnership' put to test by crisis in DRC
description: Emmanuel Macron refused to call out Rwanda for its responsibility for the destabilization of the east of the country, thus annoying his Congolese counterpart.

title: Thousands left homeless after fire destroys Rohingya refugee camp
description: A massive fire raced through a crammed camp of Rohingya refugees in southern Bangladesh on Sunday, March 5, leaving thousands homeless, a fire official and the United Nations said.

title: CMA CGM becomes France's most profitable company
description: The shipping giant has posted profits of €23.5 billion in 2022, unprecedented in French economic history.

title: Michelin 2023 awards: Alexandre Couillon, the only French chef to win the coveted three stars
description: After a difficult start, the chef has made his isolated restaurant La Marine a destination thanks to a highly personal cuisine that gives pride of place to products from the sea and his vegetable garden.

title: Greek railway disaster: Prime minister's apology does not appease anger
description: Amidst widespread protests, Kyriakos Mitsotakis asked the population for forgiveness after the accident that killed at least 57 people: 'We cannot hide behind human error.'

title: 'Russia, an aggressor in Europe, manages to present itself in Africa as a defender of the victims of imperialism'
description: Distrust of the West and the history of Soviet support for independence struggles, has secured Vladimir Putin the support of many African states, according to Philippe Bernard.

title: South Korea to compensate victims of Japan's forced wartime labour
description: The plans come without direct Japanese involvement as Seoul seeks to 'restore healthy ties' with Tokyo to counter Pyongyang.

title: In Iran, five months of revolt filmed by the people
description: Since September 2022, men and women have been protesting against the Iranian government, filming moments of violence but also of collective momentum. 'Le Monde' publishes these videos with the help of two Iranian experts, who have analyzed and verified them.

title: Germany embraces 'a country for immigrants' role in the face of labor shortage
description: Faced with a shortage of skilled labor and an aging population, Germany is fundamentally reforming its legislation to facilitate immigration.

title: Relations between Poland and Belarus are as tense as ever
description: Warsaw has closed its most important border crossing with Belarus causing delays and economic disruption for truckers and businesses at the border.

title: In France, frog legs are still going strong
description: The emblematic amphibian of French gastronomy has become increasingly rare. But the appetite for its delicate meat persists, as renowned chefs are putting it back on the menu.
